cs.IT, cs.SP, cs.LG, cs.NA, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the recovery of signals from an underdetermined system of linear equations, which is a common problem in signal processing and information theory. The use of block-sparsity is a specific approach to this problem, which suggests that the signal has nonzero entries occurring in clusters. This is a well-studied topic in compressed sensing and sparse signal recovery, which are subfields of information theory and signal processing. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.SP (Signal Processing) are the most likely sub-categories for this paper. 

The paper also introduces a block-coherence measure and uses it to derive an uncertainty relation for block-sparse signals. This suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the subfield of machine learning, specifically in the area of feature selection and dimensionality reduction. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) is also a likely sub-category. 

The paper also discusses the use of the orthogonal matching pursuit algorithm and mixed-optimization approach for signal recovery. These are numerical optimization techniques that are commonly used in scientific computing and numerical analysis. Therefore, cs.NA (Numerical Analysis) is another possible sub-category. 

Finally, the paper emphasizes the importance of exploiting the block-sparsity structure of the signal, which is a topic that is relevant to the subfield of structured signal processing. Therefore, cs.SI (Signal and Image Processing) is another possible
